text:
These books are made of leather,/ Hand heavy with trimmings/ Brushed in gold./ We open the fronts/ A thin few pages/ At a time.

/ We open the backs the same./ Then front./ Then back.

/ A holy rite/ Midward creasing.

/ We learn that the binding/ Breathes this way,/ Shivers and settles/ Into new life.

/ Old to ancient words/ Popping up/ For fresh delights./
